medical_history.chief_complaint: Fertility treatment with unstable AMH levels in a 32-year-old woman with idiopathic hypogonadotropic hypogonadism.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Patient presented at age 14 for delayed secondary sexual development. Initially presented with low levels of FSH, LH, estradiol, and a low AMH of 0.20 ng/ml and an AFC of 0. Over 16 weeks of treatment with human menopausal gonadotropins, AMH and AFC gradually increased, peaking at 1.26 ng/ml and 6, respectively. The patient conceived during the third cycle of treatment.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Delayed secondary sexual development diagnosed at age 14; idiopathic hypogonadotropic hypogonadism.
medical_history.family_history: Younger sister diagnosed with classical Kallman's syndrome and also presented with delayed secondary sexual development.
medical_history.social_history: Works as an elementary teacher, denies regular exercise.
